docs.snippet: The nominees for Movieguide's "Best 2009 Movies for Mature Audiences," which honors "moral and spiritual principles" along with cinematic achievement, includes "Terminator Salvation."...
docs.lead_paragraph: The rap on Academy members is that most of them are older folk who don't get out much. Sort of like future bloggers. Anyway, perhaps they'd still be interested in R.S.V.P.ing to Movieguide's "Best 2009 Movies for Mature Audiences" awards event, which honors "moral and spiritual principles" along with cinematic achievement. The nominees this year include "The Blind Side," "Invictus," "Julie & Julia," and of course, that high point of inspirational ethics, "Terminator Salvation."
docs.abstract: The nominees for Movieguide's "Best 2009 Movies for Mature Audiences," which honors "moral and spiritual principles" along with cinematic achievement, includes "Terminator Salvation."

docs.snippet: Countering a disturbing trend, the number of illegally copied screeners of Oscar-nominated movies has fallen this year....
docs.lead_paragraph: There's good news for the Academy on the piracy front. (Boy. How long have we been waiting to write that sentence?) Andy Baio, a technology guru and writer from Portland, Ore., has been tracking the availability of digitally ripped copies of Oscar-nominated movies since 2003, and reports that this year "the tide may be turning."
docs.abstract: Countering a disturbing trend, the number of illegally copied screeners of Oscar-nominated movies has fallen this year.

docs.snippet: A.O. Scott wrote: If "The Hurt Locker" is not the best action movie of the summer, I'll blow up my car. Do you think the film is worthy of nine Oscar nominations?...
docs.lead_paragraph: A movie set in Iraq, "The Hurt Locker," has been nominated for nine Academy Awards. It leads the Oscar field alongside James Cameron's 3-D blockbuster Avatar, about a paraplegic ex-Marine waging war on the distant moon Pandora.
docs.abstract: A.O. Scott wrote: If "The Hurt Locker" is not the best action movie of the summer, I'll blow up my car. Do you think the film is worthy of nine Oscar nominations?

headline.main: Nine Oscar Nods for 'The Hurt Locker'? Tell Us What You Think

docs.snippet: Shorts International and Magnolia Pictures are teaming up again to make sure the Oscar nominees for animated and live-action shorts get a theatrical release....
docs.lead_paragraph: Amid the excitement of the Oscar nominations announced on Tuesday, the animated and live action short film nominees may have escaped your attention, but not that of some movie executives, who are taking their commercial possibilities very seriously. At the IFC Theater in New York, last year's program of Oscar Shorts holds the record for the biggest single-screen, opening weekend revenues, bringing in $24,006.
docs.abstract: Shorts International and Magnolia Pictures are teaming up again to make sure the Oscar nominees for animated and live-action shorts get a theatrical release.

headline.main: A Little Love for Short Films

docs.snippet: Sandra Bullock has received some Academy love, but not all sassy Southerners were enamored with Ms. Bullock's portrayal of a Memphis matriarch....
docs.lead_paragraph: The not-so-surprising surprise addition to the best actress Oscar list, Sandra Bullock, has won a bunch of awards this season for playing a sassy Southerner with a heart of gold and hair of platinum in "The Blind Side." As Leigh Anne Tuohy, a real-life Memphis matriarch who takes in a near-homeless black teenager and helps him be all he can be, Ms. Bullock sports a lot of jewelry and a bit of twang. The Academy, of course, loves physical transformation. But not all sassy Southerners were enamored with Ms. Bullock. "Just for the record, those of us here in Memphis are not necessarily impressed with Ms. Bullock's accent," Susanne Nan Bayes Koenig wrote to the Bagger recently to register a complaint. "She sounds like she is from Georgia, where the film was shot. Lovely woman, great work, two states off."
docs.abstract: Sandra Bullock has received some Academy love, but not all sassy Southerners were enamored with Ms. Bullock's portrayal of a Memphis matriarch.

docs.snippet: BROWN--David, 93, acclaimed movie producer, author and journalist, passed away on Monday, February 1, 2010, at his home in Manhattan. Brown's legendary career as a movie producer and executive spanned six decades, included four Academy Award nomin...
docs.lead_paragraph: BROWN--David, 93, acclaimed movie producer, author and journalist, passed away on Monday, February 1, 2010, at his home in Manhattan. Brown's legendary career as a movie producer and executive spanned six decades, included four Academy Award nominations and produced smash box office hits like Oscar winners The Sting and Jaws, along with popular classics like Cocoon and Driving Miss Daisy. He was married for more than 50 years to Cosmopolitan magazine editor and author Helen Gurley Brown. Brown and his wife have been celebrated as anchors of both the Hollywood film and New York publishing communities. A public funeral will be held on Thursday, February 4 at 3:30pm at the Frank E. Campbell Funeral Chapel (1076 Madison Ave. at 81st St.) in New York City.

docs.snippet: With Toyota recalling cars, what will celebrities drive to the Oscars if not their beloved Priuses?...
docs.lead_paragraph: With the news that thousands of Toyotas are being recalled because of acceleration and brake problems, and the federal transportation secretary, Ray LaHood, Wednesday morning asking people not to drive the cars at all, the Bagger has a pressing question: What will celebrities drive to the Oscars if not their precious Priuses?
docs.abstract: With Toyota recalling cars, what will celebrities drive to the Oscars if not their beloved Priuses?

headline.main: A New Set of Wheels for the Big Show?

docs.snippet: Smaller films always get a boost from Oscar nominations, but even "Avatar" is hoping the latest bit of hype lures some reluctant moviegoers....
docs.lead_paragraph: As the sheen settles from nomination day on Tuesday, Hollywood types are taking stock of what really matters: money.
docs.abstract: Smaller films always get a boost from Oscar nominations, but even "Avatar" is hoping the latest bit of hype lures some reluctant moviegoers.
